hi and welcome you're listening to the

its foot off the pedal
we are coasting to the collapse let's

created a cryptocurrency called the el
petrol and right now they are
state-owned oil company PDVSA they will

all of its transactions on August 20th
now we need to remember the central
banks they do not like the crypto market
it is way too hard to control something
that is completely decentralized and NL
if you like oh no it's centralized no it
is decentralized the only thing that's
centralised right now are the exchanges
and very soon those will be
decentralized and a central bank needs
to control the creation of that currency
or the coin or whatever you're going to
have they need centralization where
everything comes from them they can't
have it where it's decentralized they
don't have control over it
they can't push the button stop the
button from creating currency they just
can't do it this is why countries this
is why people this is why businesses are
looking at this because they realize
this takes the control out of the

will move forward
as the Fiat system dies now his gold and

and silver has been around for thousands

people think like oh you can either have

form of transacting
on a low level Gold is retaining your

you know think you can't have both but
you can now what we're seeing here is
that this entire system it's breaking
down and we've been following all the
different indicators and we've looked in
the past at the credit impulse and China
China's credit impulse has been
shrinking and their shadow banking debt
is collapsing now the latest data showed
that China's credit impulse is still
negative and remains at the lowest level
it has been for two years now people say
what what are you talking about what is
the credit impulse well the credit
impulse is a term coined by Michael
Biggs then economist at Deutsche Bank
when in 2008 he defined it as the change
a new credit issued as a percent of GDP
now when we look at the credit impulse
we can see that it has been declining
for quite a while it's been the negative
territory and a lot of people look at
this and say well if it's in negative
territory
everything must crash well that's not
exactly true when the credit impulse
turns negative it's very similar to
taking your foot off the gas pedal now
you're moving forward at say let's say
60 miles per hour you take your foot off
the gas pedal does your car come to a
complete stop no it does not what does
it do it rolls forward for a period of
time
the central bank's right now they are
taking their foot off the gas pedal and
we're starting to see certain things
happen the credit impulse is declining
we're starting to see real estate
implode on itself retail is a complete
and utter design
the job situation even though the
numbers show us that we're at full
employment is absolutely ridiculous we
have a lot of part-time people wages are

they've taken their foot off the gas

going to coast towards a collapse that

what happens is we were moving at a

now we both have the central bank and

there's going to speak certainly others
they might even switch to crypto

yes in some fashion they're still using
